About.Bio:
Some people also call me Emilie Ma.
I'm a resilient 14-year-old software developer, navigating through frontend, backend, and upside-down development. I have a keen interest in automation, especially in creating robust, reusable frameworks and stable command-line interfaces.

Studies.Name: University Transition Program
Studies.Bio:
The University Transition Program is a radically accelerated environment with the goal of early entrance into university - specifically UBC.
I'm currently in my first year out of two, and am planning to enter UBC at age 15.

Activities.Text: co-lead Coding Club, guiding peers into the basics of üêç Python and üîë cryptography skills.
compete in üö® Reach for the Top

Experience.Description: In 2019, I was a üèÜ [Google Code-in](https://g.co/gci) winner, under Liquid Galaxy. For two months, I completed many open source tasks, and eventually won this worldwide competition. I'm one of Canada's six winners to date, the only female, and the youngest Canadian winner. As well: I was the youngest winner in 2019. Pretty cool.

Intern at üåé [Liquid Galaxy](https://liquidgalaxy.eu), a Google-backed open source organization focused on interactive, immersive geographical displays. There, I develop documentation, webinar screencasts, and manage the Arduino controller project!

Teen Ambassador at üá®üá¶ [Canada Learning Code](https://canadalearningcode.ca), a national organization reaching out to bring tech to women, girls, LGBTQ+ members, and focusing on making tech inclusive to all. There, I participate in team-building leadership activities, and organize meetups.

Teen Advisory Member at the üìô [Vancouver Public Library](https://vpl.ca), the local library serving Vancouver community members. There, I work to organize youth events, purchase youth books, provide feedback on programs, and attend monthly youth meetings. As well, I review teen literature under the Teens Read it First program.

Skills.Title: Web Development
Skills.Desc: Handcrafting websites with HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Bulma, Vue and other frameworks. Creating static encounters with Hugo.

Skills.Title: Python
Skills.Desc: Applying open source libraries to create graphical and command-line utilities. Automating redundant tasks in the terminal.

Skills.Title: Git // VCS
Skills.Desc: Utilizing graphical and terminal workflows for version control. Leveraging GitHub to spread open source technology and to benefit others.

Skills.Title: Game Development
Skills.Desc: Using Unity to create immersive 2D and 3D experiences with C#. Graduate of Under the GUI *2016 - 2018*

Skills.Title: Productivity Tools
Skills.Desc: Dual user of Windows and Linux, building productive development workflows and environments.

Skills.Title: Open Source Contributions
Skills.Desc: Participated in Hacktoberfest 2019, contributing to a variety of open source projects, including CircleCI, PublicLab, and the Accord Project.
